ETYMOLOGY: From Greek dikhotomia 'a cutting in two', from dikho- 'in two, apart' + tomia 'a cutting' (from temnein 'to cut').

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a dichotomy [between A and B] | a dichotomy [of X]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: (noun) a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A division or contrast between two things that are or are represented as being entirely different.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 两种被认为对立或完全不同的事物之间的分歧或对比。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The fundamental dichotomy between good and evil is a common theme in literature.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 善与恶的根本对立是文学中的一个常见主题。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: (noun) a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A division into two mutually exclusive, opposed, or contradictory groups or parts.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 将事物分为两个互斥、对立或矛盾的群体或部分（逻辑或哲学概念）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: In some philosophical systems, a strict dichotomy exists between mind and body.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在某些哲学体系中，身心之间存在严格的二分法。
